intro: Oxytropis hailarensis var. chankaensis, commonly known as the Chanka locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its habitat and appearance, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
